trans-unit.source: Zip or city
Radius
Distance
Did you mean:
BasicSettings
Sphinx
DoYouMean
DistanceSearch
API
Ranking
Headless
Settings
How many results should be shown in autocomplete?

Enable Sphinxsearch:This use useful if you have a mass of data to be indexed (>20.000). Because of the bad FULLTEXT index we decide to insert an external indexer called Sphinx. Searching with Sphinx is realy fast, but you have to install this program on your server on your own. Please have a look into our documentation to find out how to install sphinxsearch.

Enable "Did you mean"-Feature: Proposes alternative search words if no search results have been found. The API of www.openthesaurus.de is used for this feature therefore it's only available in german. IMPORTANT: You have active "Show individual text if no results were found?" in the ke_search plugin additionally to the activation here in the extension manager.
Autocomplete:After entering some letters this feature gives you a list of already entered searchword of other website visitors.This might be helpful to find to correct word much faster.

Synonyms: There are words out there which have to same meaning. Instead of entering all these words one after the other into the searchbox you can create a synonym record. Enter one of the words in to searchphrase and then add all known synonyms enter divided in to the synonym box. Now you can search for one of the words and in background a search with ALL synonyms will be executed.

In-word-search: This feature additionally indexes parts of words. Parts of words will be found even if they are not at the beginning of the word, e.g. searching for "burg" finds "Hamburg". This feature does NOT need Sphinx to be installed, it works natively with MySQL. Start the indexing process after activating this feature. The indexing time will increase.
Enable the distance search:Search by distance to a given position, includes displaying the results on a map. Make sure php extension "curl" is installed!
Enable API:Allow access to ke_search index data by remote TYPO3 installations.
Link for XML-Format:This is the wrapping link which calls the www.openthesaurus.de API to get the result in XML format
Link for JSON-Format:This is the wrapping link which calls the www.openthesaurus.de API to get the result in JSON format (BETA)
Choose API Format:In which format the API should return the results. In most cases it should be XML because JSON is currently in BETA status

Max distance: the lower this setting is as more equal is the new word to the given search word. A distance of 1 will find "auto" for "autho" but not "paaren" for "parken". In this case you have to set max distance to 2.
Google Maps Api Key:In order to access the Google Maps API you need a Key provided by Google. You can get a key at https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/get-api-key.
Google Geocoding Api Key:In order to access the Google Geocoding API you need a Key provided by Google. You can get a key at https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/start.
Default Country:Since the user only enters a zip code in the search form, the country is needed for the geocoding the zip code. Also uses as default country for tt_address geocoding.

Add distance to default template:If you use the default template, you can add the distance to the default template. If you use your own template, you can use the variable "{distance}" (in the "ResultRow" partial).

Add map to default template:If you use the default template, you can add the map (Google Maps) to the default template (using the variable {resultListAdditionalRawContent}). If you use your own template, you can use the variable "
" (in the "ResultList" template).
Username for API access:Set a username for API access.
Password for API access:Set a password for API access.
Enable boost keywords:Use keywords to boost certain results. Keywords can be set in pages and news (use the default keyword fields). Keywords are not visible in the search result list.
Factor for boost keywords:This defines how strong the effect of the boost keywords is. Default: 5.
Enable custom ranking:Set custom values in indexer configurations and pages and rank results depending on these values. Note: Please set the sorting in the searchbox plugin to "customranking".
Headless content elements:Comma-separated list of UIDs of content elements (ke_search search box or ke_search result list) that are allowed to return output in JSON format.
Headless IP list:Comma-separated list of IP addresses that are allowed to access the headless function. Corresponds to the configuration of [BE][IPmaskList], e.g. "123.45.67.89,192.168.*.*"

Headless Fields Whitelist:Semicolon-separated list of fields which should be included in the response. Fields in a multidimensional array must be combined with a dash, the sub-fields must then be added with a colon and separated with a colon. Example: "page;searchword;searchwordDefault;sortByField;sortByDir;filters;filters:title,name,id,checkboxOptions;filters-checkboxOptions:title,tag,slug,key,id;isEmptySearch;wordsTooShort;resultrows;resultrows:title_text,content_text,title,teaser,type,number;numberofresults; queryTime;queryTimeText;pagebrowser;pagebrowser:current,pages_total,start,end"
